result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney D Nixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.
Probation review hearing November 18, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
Batterers Intervention Program at the Alma center.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Any treatment at the discretion of the agent.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with A.M.
No use or possession of firearms.
Full time work, school or a combination.
Court will set restitution at next court date. Hearing October 24, 2022 at 4:00 p,m,

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges, DNA and DV during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rodney D Nixon

records.addlTxt:
Court is in Jury Trial and unable to hear this case.  Court will address restitution hearing on probation review hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Entry and plea addendum filed into this case in error, documents from this event moved to the proper case 22CM1877.

Defendant Rodney D Nixon in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Rodney D Nixon.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, straight time, consecutive to any other sentence.

STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months with the following conditions:

- ON CASE 22CM1378, COUNT 2: Court ordered 30 days condition time; STAYED, to be used at the discretion of the probation agent.
- Batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Any treatment at the discretion of the agent.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No contact with AM.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Court will set restitution at next court date.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Rodney D Nixon in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Rodney D Nixon.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: On state's motion, Court ordered "Habitual Criminality Repeater" enhancer dismissed.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Letter of Support for Victim
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Victim Impact Statement -- AM
Received and Filed. Victim Restitution Form -- AM
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Rodney D Nixon not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Rodney D Nixon.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date. Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Rodney D Nixon not in court, in custody. Student Intern Paul Lasswell under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-18-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ATM.

Defendant Rodney D Nixon in court.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Witness Advocate and Victim present. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/16/2022 @1p
